segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4

segments.pli: 17. Paṭipadāvagga
segments.en: 17. Practice

segments.pli: 163. Asubhasutta
segments.en: 163. Ugly

segments.pli: “Catasso imā, bhikkhave, paṭipadā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are four ways of practice.

segments.pli: Katamā catasso?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Dukkhā paṭipadā dandhābhiññā, dukkhā paṭipadā khippābhiññā, sukhā paṭipadā dandhābhiññā, sukhā paṭipadā khippābhiññā.
segments.en:
1. Painful practice with slow insight,
  2. painful practice with swift insight,
  3. pleasant practice with slow insight, and
  4. pleasant practice with swift insight.

segments.pli: Katamā ca, bhikkhave, dukkhā paṭipadā dandhābhiññā?
segments.en: And what’s the painful practice with slow insight?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu asubhānupassī kāye viharati, āhāre paṭikūlasaññī, sabbaloke anabhiratisaññī, sabbasaṅkhāresu aniccānupassī;
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant meditates observing the ugliness of the body, perceives the repulsiveness of food, perceives dissatisfaction with the whole world, observes the impermanence of all conditions,

segments.pli: maraṇasaññā kho panassa ajjhattaṃ sūpaṭṭhitā hoti.
segments.en: and has well established the perception of their own death.

segments.pli: So imāni pañca sekhabalāni upanissāya viharati—
segments.en: They rely on these five powers of a trainee:

segments.pli: saddhābalaṃ, hiribalaṃ, ottappabalaṃ, vīriyabalaṃ, paññābalaṃ.
segments.en: faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Tassimāni pañcindriyāni mudūni pātubhavanti—
segments.en: But they have these five faculties weakly:

segments.pli: saddhindriyaṃ, vīriyindriyaṃ, satindriyaṃ, samādhindriyaṃ, paññindriyaṃ.
segments.en: faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.

segments.pli: So imesaṃ pañcannaṃ indriyānaṃ muduttā dandhaṃ ānantariyaṃ pāpuṇāti āsavānaṃ khayāya.
segments.en: Because of this, they only slowly attain the conditions for ending the defilements in the present life.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, dukkhā paṭipadā dandhābhiññā.
segments.en: This is called the painful practice with slow insight.

segments.pli: Katamā ca, bhikkhave, dukkhā paṭipadā khippābhiññā?
segments.en: And what’s the painful practice with swift insight?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu asubhānupassī kāye viharati, āhāre paṭikūlasaññī, sabbaloke anabhiratisaññī, sabbasaṅkhāresu aniccānupassī;
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant meditates observing the ugliness of the body, perceives the repulsiveness of food, perceives dissatisfaction with the whole world, observes the impermanence of all conditions,

segments.pli: maraṇasaññā kho panassa ajjhattaṃ sūpaṭṭhitā hoti.
segments.en: and has well established the perception of their own death.

segments.pli: So imāni pañca sekhabalāni upanissāya viharati—
segments.en: They rely on these five powers of a trainee:

segments.pli: saddhābalaṃ … pe … paññābalaṃ.
segments.en: faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Tassimāni pañcindriyāni adhimattāni pātubhavanti—
segments.en: And they have these five faculties strongly:

segments.pli: saddhindriyaṃ … pe … paññindriyaṃ.
segments.en: faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.

segments.pli: So imesaṃ pañcannaṃ indriyānaṃ adhimattattā khippaṃ ānantariyaṃ pāpuṇāti āsavānaṃ khayāya.
segments.en: Because of this, they swiftly attain the conditions for ending the defilements in the present life.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, dukkhā paṭipadā khippābhiññā.
segments.en: This is called the painful practice with swift insight.

segments.pli: Katamā ca, bhikkhave, sukhā paṭipadā dandhābhiññā?
segments.en: And what’s the pleasant practice with slow insight?

segments.pli: Idha bhikkhave, bhikkhu vivicceva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ pītisukhaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati;
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.

segments.pli: vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamā ajjhattaṃ sampasādanaṃ cetaso ekodibhāvaṃ avitakkaṃ avicāraṃ samādhijaṃ pītisukhaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati;
segments.en: As the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, they enter and remain in the second absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of immersion, with internal clarity and confidence, and unified mind, without placing the mind and keeping it connected.

segments.pli: pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharati sato ca sampajāno sukhañca kāyena paṭisaṃvedeti yaṃ taṃ ariyā ācikkhanti: ‘upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī’ti tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati;
segments.en: And with the fading away of rapture, they enter and remain in the third absorption, where they meditate with equanimity, mindful and aware, personally experiencing the bliss of which the noble ones declare, ‘Equanimous and mindful, one meditates in bliss.’

segments.pli: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbeva somanassadomanassānaṃ atthaṅgamā adukkhamasukhaṃ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṃ catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
segments.en: Giving up pleasure and pain, and ending former happiness and sadness, they enter and remain in the fourth absorption, without pleasure or pain, with pure equanimity and mindfulness.

segments.pli: So imāni pañca sekhabalāni upanissāya viharati—
segments.en: They rely on these five powers of a trainee:

segments.pli: saddhābalaṃ … pe … paññābalaṃ.
segments.en: faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Tassimāni pañcindriyāni mudūni pātubhavanti—
segments.en: But they have these five faculties weakly:

segments.pli: saddhindriyaṃ … pe … paññindriyaṃ.
segments.en: faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.

segments.pli: So imesaṃ pañcannaṃ indriyānaṃ muduttā dandhaṃ ānantariyaṃ pāpuṇāti āsavānaṃ khayāya.
segments.en: Because of this, they only slowly attain the conditions for ending the defilements in the present life.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, sukhā paṭipadā dandhābhiññā.
segments.en: This is called the pleasant practice with slow insight.

segments.pli: Katamā ca, bhikkhave, sukhā paṭipadā khippābhiññā?
segments.en: And what’s the pleasant practice with swift insight?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vivicceva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ pītisukhaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati … pe … dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ … pe … tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ … pe … catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant … enters and remains in the first absorption … second absorption … third absorption … fourth absorption …

segments.pli: So imāni pañca sekhabalāni upanissāya viharati—
segments.en: They rely on these five powers of a trainee:

segments.pli: saddhābalaṃ, hiribalaṃ, ottappabalaṃ, vīriyabalaṃ, paññābalaṃ.
segments.en: faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Tassimāni pañcindriyāni adhimattāni pātubhavanti—
segments.en: And they have these five faculties strongly:

segments.pli: saddhindriyaṃ, vīriyindriyaṃ, satindriyaṃ, samādhindriyaṃ, paññindriyaṃ.
segments.en: faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.

segments.pli: So imesaṃ pañcannaṃ indriyānaṃ adhimattattā khippaṃ ānantariyaṃ pāpuṇāti āsavānaṃ khayāya.
segments.en: Because of this, they swiftly attain the conditions for ending the defilements in the present life.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, sukhā paṭipadā khippābhiññā.
segments.en: This is called the pleasant practice with swift insight.

segments.pli: Imā kho, bhikkhave, catasso paṭipadā”ti.
segments.en: These are the four ways of practice.”

segments.pli: Tatiyaṃ.
